seller_description: Product Description: CELSIUS is functional, Essential Energy, a better-for-you, premium alternative to traditional energy drinks. As a global, lifestyle fitness drink, CELSIUS was created to help people LIVE FIT, exceed their goals and elevate their everyday lives. Made with proven, premium ingredients, 7 Essential Vitamins and zero sugar, no artificial colors, no aspartame, no high fructose corn syrup and non-GMO. CELSIUS is vegan, gluten-free and Kosher. Our proprietary MetaPlus blend contains green tea extract with EGCG. It also includes guarana seed extract, ginger root for flavor and digestion, vitamin C to help support your immune system, vitamin B for energy production, and chromium to help control hunger, making it an ideal pre-workout drink. Non-carbonated CELSIUS Peach Mango Green Tea combines the tropical sweetness of mangos and juicy, vibrant peaches without all the bubbles. Reminiscent of a brisk, refreshing peach iced tea. Made with clinically proven ingredients, this carbonated flavor of CELSIUS has the perfect balance of flavor and energy that serves as an awesome pick-me-up for active lifestyles. Make CELSIUS your go-to choice for Essential Energy! CELSIUS is available in 12 oz. slim cans and sold in a 12-pack for convenience. Product details. Is Discontinued By Manufacturer : No. Product Dimensions : 9.25 x 14 x 6 inches; 9.36 Pounds. Item model number : FGSS1205. UPC : 889392010558. Manufacturer : Celsius, Inc. ASIN : B00AATAHY0. Country of Origin : USA
review: I've been getting this on subscription and save and it either comes damaged or never get my full order
expected-output: Seller Description: The Celsius Sparkling Grape Rush drink is marketed as a healthier energy drink with essential vitamins, minerals, zero sugar, and natural ingredients. The product claims to offer a premium alternative to traditional energy drinks and is positioned as a lifestyle fitness drink available in a 12-pack for convenience. Buyer Review: The buyer is dissatisfied with the product due to issues with damaged items and incomplete orders. Despite subscribing to receive this product regularly, the buyer states that they either receive damaged cans or do not receive their full order. Visual Comparison: Seller Image: The product is shown in pristine condition, with neatly packed cans in a case. The cans appear undamaged and well-presented. Buyer Image: The image shows crushed cans with visible dents, and the packaging appears damaged. This is contrary to the expectation set by the seller’s description and images, where the product is depicted as in excellent condition. Discrepancies & Analysis: Condition of Product: The buyer received damaged items, whereas the seller’s description and images imply a high-quality, well-packaged product. This discrepancy suggests issues with either the product packaging or handling during delivery, which contradicts the brand’s premium image. Order Fulfillment: The buyer mentioned not receiving the full order on multiple occasions, an issue that highlights potential problems with logistics or supply chain management. This is not addressed in the seller's description, which implies a reliable, full-order delivery. Conclusion: The buyer is dissatisfied due to receiving damaged goods and incomplete orders. The dissatisfaction stems from logistical and packaging issues rather than the product itself. The fault appears to lie with either the seller’s handling, packaging, or delivery service rather than a subjective opinion about the product's quality. The experience does not align with the seller's portrayal of a premium, well-packaged energy drink. In this case, the fault lies with the seller’s handling, packaging, or delivery service rather than with the buyer or the inherent product quality. The buyer’s dissatisfaction arises from consistently receiving damaged items and incomplete orders, which are logistics and fulfillment issues. These issues contradict the premium, well-packaged portrayal in the seller’s description and images. To improve customer satisfaction, the seller could address packaging quality and review delivery processes to ensure that products arrive in pristine condition and complete quantities as advertised.
label: 0:Here seller is at fault
